programme.title: PL Greatest:Sheff Utd/Arsenal 2006
programme.desc: Sheff Utd: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For Sheffield United, the 1-0 win over Arsenal at Bramall Lane in December 2006.

programme.title: PL Greatest: Sheff Weds/Man U 1998
programme.desc: Sheff Wed: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for Sheffield Wednesday, the 3-1 win over Man Utd back in November 1998.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:Stoke/L'Pool '15
programme.desc: Stoke: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For Stoke City, the 6-1 win over Liverpool on the final day of the 2014-15 season.

programme.title: PL Greatest: N'castle/S'land 2013
programme.desc: Sunderland: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For Sunderland, the 3-0 win at rivals Newcastle in 2013, their first there in 13 years.

programme.title: RVB v MVG 2016'
programme.desc: In 2016, Michael Van Gerwen and Raymond Van Barneveld delivered a World Championship thriller on the Alexandra Palace stage. Revisit this epic encounter in London. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Taylor v Painter 2004
programme.desc: Trailing Kevin Painter 4-1, a ninth World Championship title looked out of reach for Phil Taylor. Cue a miraculous recovery and a breathtaking sudden death leg. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Taylor v Wright 2017
programme.desc: Appearing for the final time on the Winter Gardens stage, revisit Phil Taylor's World Matchplay Final with Peter Wright in 2017. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Beaton v Taylor QF 2010
programme.desc: In the quarter-final of the 2010 Grand Slam of Darts, Steve Beaton staged an incredible comeback, overcoming Phil Taylor. Contains flashing images.

programme.desc: A look at some of the greatest matches from English football. Here, League 2 side Bradford City take on Premier League giants Arsenal in the Football League Cup in December 2012.

programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, Derby County and Hull City go head-to-head in a thrilling encounter back in 2017.

programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, relive a thrilling Steel City derby between rivals Sheffield Wednesday and Sheffield United at Hillsborough Stadium.

programme.title: Brussels, My Love?
programme.desc: From the economy to the climate and the EU's role in world affairs, this talk show sheds light on European affairs and the issues that impact on our daily lives as Europeans.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: (2015) Sci-fi thriller with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke. Part five of the franchise follows Sarah Connor in an alternate timeline to the previous movies, as she takes on Skynet.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody
programme.desc: (2018) Rami Malek turns in an Oscar-winning performance as Freddie Mercury in this rollercoaster musical biopic of the late Queen frontman. Big tunes. Big drama. Bigger teeth.

programme.title: Better Things
programme.desc: (2008) Stark drama. Young villagers in the Cotswolds turn to heroin to fill their empty days and empty lives. Sexual scenes/strong language/hard drug use.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: (1970) Multi-Oscar-winning, fact-based, Second World War drama starring George C Scott, who gives a vivid portrait of the famously straight-talking US commander General George Patton.

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: (1968) Epic Second World War drama starring Robert Mitchum. A reporter gets trapped behind enemy lines during the costly 1944 Allied invasion of Italy. With Peter Falk and Robert Ryan.

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: (1973) Can Sinbad stop a master magician from reaching the Fountain of Destiny on the lost land of Lemuria and being crowned the new leader of Marabia?

programme.title: Jumanji: The Next Level
programme.desc: (2019) Adventure comedy sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black, Kevin Hart and Karen Gillan. The old school pals enter the Jumanji video game again to save their friend.

programme.title: Last Night in Soho
programme.desc: (2021) Edgar Wright's horror with Thomasin McKenzie, Anya Taylor-Joy and Matt Smith. A fashion student's transported back to Swinging-60s London. But nostalgia's not what it used to be...

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
programme.desc: (2019) Quentin Tarantino's darkly comic drama set in 60s LA, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt and Margot Robbie. A failing actor's world collides with the Manson Family.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: (1948) Spy thriller. Robert Beatty, Simone Signoret, Jack Warner and Gordon Jackson star as British-trained saboteurs sent to Second World War Belgium. But one of them is a traitor...

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: (1954) Oscar-nominated Humphrey Bogart, in one of his finest roles, stars in Edward Dmytryk's gripping drama as Captain Philip Queeg, in charge of a US Navy minesweeper during the war.

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: (1967) Julie Christie and Terence Stamp star in John Schlesinger's adaptation of Thomas Hardy's novel. Bathsheba is not short of suitors, but will marrying any of them lead to happiness?

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: (2022) It's Predator, 1719 style. Amber Midthunder stars as a Comanche hunter who must save her tribe from an extraterrestrial threat in this action prequel. If it bleeds, you can kill it.

programme.title: The Running Man
programme.desc: (1987) Classic 80s dystopian thriller, based on a Stephen King novel. Gadget-wielding murderers hunt an innocent man (Arnold Schwarzenegger) on a sick TV show.

programme.title: Sicario 2: Soldado
programme.desc: (2018) Action sequel with Benicio Del Toro and Josh Brolin. Two operatives must create a gang war to stop Mexican drug cartels smuggling terrorists into the US.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: (1968) Burt Lancaster stars as the angst-ridden middle-aged man who decides to swim home via neighbour's pools in Frank and Eleanor Perry's superb allegorical drama.

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: (1959) Comedy western with Kenneth More. An English gunsmith decides the Wild West is the best market for his wares, but little does he expect to end up sheriff of a lawless frontier town.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: (1957) Drama with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon. Two friends agree to smuggle a mysterious European woman across the border, but she soon has them at each other's throats.

programme.title: Daleks Invasion Earth 2150 A.D.
programme.desc: (1966) A sci-fi classic with Peter Cushing. Dr Who travels to the future only to find the Daleks have conquered the Earth! Can he stop them nuking the planet's core? With Bernard Cribbins.

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: (2008) Remake of the sci-fi classic with Keanu Reeves. An alien visits Earth to tell humankind to stop destroying the planet. But when he's attacked, he decides to eradicate us instead...

programme.title: The Creator
programme.desc: (2023) Sci-fi extravaganza starring John David Washington. An undercover operative must destroy a superweapon in a war against AI. But the superweapon looks like a little girl.

programme.title: Boss Level
programme.desc: (2020) Groundhog day shoot 'em up with Frank Grillo, Naomi Watts and Mel Gibson. Ray gets killed every day. Can he escape by unravelling the mystery of why a bunch of people want him dead?

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: (2015) Sci-fi thriller with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke. Part five of the franchise follows Sarah Connor in an alternate timeline to the previous movies, as she takes on Skynet.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody
programme.desc: (2018) Rami Malek turns in an Oscar-winning performance as Freddie Mercury in this rollercoaster musical biopic of the late Queen frontman. Big tunes. Big drama. Bigger teeth.

programme.title: Better Things
programme.desc: (2008) Stark drama. Young villagers in the Cotswolds turn to heroin to fill their empty days and empty lives. Sexual scenes/strong language/hard drug use.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: (1970) Multi-Oscar-winning, fact-based, Second World War drama starring George C Scott, who gives a vivid portrait of the famously straight-talking US commander General George Patton.

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: (1968) Epic Second World War drama starring Robert Mitchum. A reporter gets trapped behind enemy lines during the costly 1944 Allied invasion of Italy. With Peter Falk and Robert Ryan.

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: (1973) Can Sinbad stop a master magician from reaching the Fountain of Destiny on the lost land of Lemuria and being crowned the new leader of Marabia?

programme.title: Jumanji: The Next Level
programme.desc: (2019) Adventure comedy sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black, Kevin Hart and Karen Gillan. The old school pals enter the Jumanji video game again to save their friend.

programme.title: Last Night in Soho
programme.desc: (2021) Edgar Wright's horror with Thomasin McKenzie, Anya Taylor-Joy and Matt Smith. A fashion student's transported back to Swinging-60s London. But nostalgia's not what it used to be...

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
programme.desc: (2019) Quentin Tarantino's darkly comic drama set in 60s LA, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt and Margot Robbie. A failing actor's world collides with the Manson Family.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: (1948) Spy thriller. Robert Beatty, Simone Signoret, Jack Warner and Gordon Jackson star as British-trained saboteurs sent to Second World War Belgium. But one of them is a traitor...

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: (1954) Oscar-nominated Humphrey Bogart, in one of his finest roles, stars in Edward Dmytryk's gripping drama as Captain Philip Queeg, in charge of a US Navy minesweeper during the war.

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: (1967) Julie Christie and Terence Stamp star in John Schlesinger's adaptation of Thomas Hardy's novel. Bathsheba is not short of suitors, but will marrying any of them lead to happiness?

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: (2022) It's Predator, 1719 style. Amber Midthunder stars as a Comanche hunter who must save her tribe from an extraterrestrial threat in this action prequel. If it bleeds, you can kill it.

programme.title: The Running Man
programme.desc: (1987) Classic 80s dystopian thriller, based on a Stephen King novel. Gadget-wielding murderers hunt an innocent man (Arnold Schwarzenegger) on a sick TV show.

programme.title: Sicario 2: Soldado
programme.desc: (2018) Action sequel with Benicio Del Toro and Josh Brolin. Two operatives must create a gang war to stop Mexican drug cartels smuggling terrorists into the US.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: (1968) Burt Lancaster stars as the angst-ridden middle-aged man who decides to swim home via neighbour's pools in Frank and Eleanor Perry's superb allegorical drama.

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: (1959) Comedy western with Kenneth More. An English gunsmith decides the Wild West is the best market for his wares, but little does he expect to end up sheriff of a lawless frontier town.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: (1957) Drama with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon. Two friends agree to smuggle a mysterious European woman across the border, but she soon has them at each other's throats.

programme.title: Daleks Invasion Earth 2150 A.D.
programme.desc: (1966) A sci-fi classic with Peter Cushing. Dr Who travels to the future only to find the Daleks have conquered the Earth! Can he stop them nuking the planet's core? With Bernard Cribbins.

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: (2008) Remake of the sci-fi classic with Keanu Reeves. An alien visits Earth to tell humankind to stop destroying the planet. But when he's attacked, he decides to eradicate us instead...

programme.title: The Creator
programme.desc: (2023) Sci-fi extravaganza starring John David Washington. An undercover operative must destroy a superweapon in a war against AI. But the superweapon looks like a little girl.

programme.desc: Wolf Pack: The definitive guide to World War II, narrated by the late, great Laurence Olivier. Hear how German U-boats caused havoc among Allied merchant shipping in the Atlantic.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: St Fagans: Fiona Bruce and the experts head to the Natural History Museum of Wales at St Fagans, near Cardiff. Among the items featured is a doll given as a gift by Queen Mary.

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Lucknow to Kolkata: In Lucknow, Michael Portillo tastes the kebabs, stops off at Bodh Gaya, and in Kolkata, he glimpses colonial Calcutta in the grand Great Eastern Hotel.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: A Day Out: A day on the moors digging drains for the council is bound to offer an opportunity for Fletch to take advantage - especially with Mr Barrowclough in charge. Classic laughs.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Ways and Means: Criminally funny sitcom. Fletch falls out with the governor and loses all his credibility. But he hopes to get back into his good books via a cosy job in the library.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Men without Women: Only Ronnie Barker could make prison funny. When Fletcher assumes the role of agony aunt to his fellow inmates, he ends up writing letters home to their loved ones.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Vauxhall Cresta: Paul's doing the pick-ups in Lancashire where a rare 1960 Vauxhall Cresta PA Friary estate in dusky pink awaits.
